intro: Campuloclinium frutescens, commonly known as the Florida starflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, star-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, giving the plant a distinctive appearance. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal dunes and maritime hammocks.
